metadata.title: CVE-2022-30688 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
needrestart 0.8 through 3.5 before 3.6 is prone to local privilegeescalation. Regexes to detect the Perl, Python, and Ruby interpreters arenot anchored, allowing a local user to escalate privileges when needrestarttries to detect if interpreters are using old source files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30688` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

needrestart - 3.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: needrestart package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1-1ubuntu0.1').
